title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti al dente.
While pasta cooks, fry pancetta in a large pan until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and mix with grated cheeses and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving a cup of pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the pancetta pan, remove from heat.
Quickly add egg mixture, stirring constantly to create a creamy sauce.
Add pasta water as needed to adjust consistency.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and 1 tbsp tikka paste for 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked through and slightly charred.
In a separate pan, melt butter and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and remaining spices, cook for 2 minutes.
Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Blend sauce until smooth, then return to pan.
Add cooked chicken and cream, simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: Fresh vegetables quickly cooked in a wok with savory sauces and spices.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add onions and carrots, cook for 2 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add soy sauce and oyster sauce, toss to combine.
Drizzle with sesame oil and serve immediately with rice.
Garnish with sesame seeds if desired.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic homemade cookies with melty chocolate chips and a soft center.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line baking sheets with parchment.
Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg and vanilla extract until combined.
Gradually mix in flour mixture until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden but centers are soft.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

title: Beef Bourguignon
summary: French beef stew braised in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and bacon.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C).
Season beef with salt and pepper, brown in batches in a Dutch oven.
Cook bacon until crispy, remove and set aside.
Sauté vegetables in the same pot until softened.
Add flour and cook for 1 minute, then add tomato paste.
Deglaze with red wine, scraping up browned bits.
Add beef stock, browned beef, bacon, and bouquet garni.
Cover and braise in oven for 3-4 hours until beef is tender.
Sauté mushrooms separately and add to stew before serving.

title: Greek Salad
summary: Fresh Mediterranean salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese.
instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, bell pepper, and olives in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt and pepper.
Pour dressing over vegetables and toss gently to combine.
Add feta cheese cubes and gently mix.
Let salad sit for 10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve as a side dish or with crusty bread for a light meal.
